criteria: Accuracy of information presented regarding the causes and symptoms of diseases.
Depth of investigation into both communicable and non-communicable diseases.
descriptions: Information is missing or entirely inaccurate.
Information is largely inaccurate with significant gaps in understanding.
Information contains inaccuracies or omissions regarding causes and symptoms.
Information is mostly accurate with minor omissions or inaccuracies.
Information is accurate and complete, showing a solid understanding of the causes and symptoms.
Information is exceptionally accurate, detailed, and demonstrates a comprehensive understanding of the causes and symptoms of various diseases, including nuances and complexities.
No attempt to investigate causes and symptoms of diseases.
Superficial investigation with minimal detail on either communicable or non-communicable diseases.
Investigates causes and symptoms, but lacks depth in either communicable or non-communicable diseases.
Adequately investigates causes and symptoms of both communicable and non-communicable diseases with some depth.
In-depth investigation into the causes and symptoms of both communicable and non-communicable diseases.
Extensive and thorough investigation that goes beyond basic understanding to explore the complexities and interrelationships of communicable and non-communicable diseases.
Presentation is disorganized and unclear; difficult to understand.
Presentation lacks organization and clarity; difficult to follow.
Presentation is somewhat organized but lacks clarity in places.
Presentation is generally clear and organized, but could benefit from minor improvements.
Presentation is clear, well-organized, and easy to understand.
Presentation is exceptionally clear, logically organized, and engaging, demonstrating excellent communication skills.
